trans-unit.source: The IAuthorizeRemotingConnection interface provides methods that indicate whether a client is authorized to connect on the current channel, based on the client's network address and user identity.

An instance of the IAuthorizeRemotingConnection interface is passed to <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.Tcp.TcpServerChannel.%23ctor%28System.Collections.IDictionary%2CSystem.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.IServerChannelSinkProvider%2CSystem.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.IAuthorizeRemotingConnection%29>.
It provides a single point of authorization for all incoming connections on a <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.Tcp.TcpServerChannel>.
It allows for the authorization of the caller before any incoming messages are deserialized to minimize the security threat from untrusted sources.
Gets a Boolean value that indicates whether the network address of the client is authorized to connect on the current channel.

An instance of the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.IAuthorizeRemotingConnection> interface is passed to <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.Tcp.TcpServerChannel.%23ctor%28System.Collections.IDictionary%2CSystem.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.IServerChannelSinkProvider%2CSystem.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.IAuthorizeRemotingConnection%29>.
It provides a single point of authorization for all incoming connections on a <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.Tcp.TcpServerChannel>.
It allows for the authorization of the caller before any incoming messages are deserialized to minimize the security threat from untrusted sources.
The <xref:System.Net.EndPoint> that identifies the network address of the client.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the network address of the client is authorized; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a Boolean value that indicates whether the user identity of the client is authorized to connect on the current channel.

An instance of the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.IAuthorizeRemotingConnection> interface is passed to <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.Tcp.TcpServerChannel.%23ctor%28System.Collections.IDictionary%2CSystem.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.IServerChannelSinkProvider%2CSystem.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.IAuthorizeRemotingConnection%29>.
It provides a single point of authorization for all incoming connections on a <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.Tcp.TcpServerChannel>.
It allows for the authorization of the caller before any incoming messages are deserialized to minimize the security threat from untrusted sources.
The <xref:System.Security.Principal.IIdentity> that represents the user identity of the client.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the user identity of the client is authorized; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
